position.marginalia_text: Pra[e]ter cuiusq[ue] artis, philosophia[e], professionis; maximarum deniq[ue] arc[ano]rum Singulares bibliothecas: eccè Eutrapeli sex propria[e] dactilotheca[e]: Suo adamantino discursui, styloq[ue] [a]ccommodatissima[e]. Dactil[o]theca apophthegmatum: D. Prouerbio[r]um: D. emblematum: Dactil. g[em]marum, et regularum: Dactil. grammatum: et ha[e]c Io[--]um Pe[cul]iaris dactilotheca. Aurea[e] Eutrap[e]li Ephemerides: et Specula Eu[dr]omi adamantina. Huc etiam flores Poetarum; doctoru[m]; Legum. Certè pulcherrima, et [--]ssima fl[ori]legia. Nec ulla[e] [antho]logia[e] [--]. [--]

marginalia.translation: Besides [the singular libraries] of whatever art, philosophy, and profession; finally the singular libraries of the arcane maxims: behold the six of Eutrapelus' own catalogues: with his adamantine discourse and most suitable style. Catalogues of aphorisms, proverbs, emblems, gems, and rules: and this private catalogue [...]. The golden diaries of Eutrapelus: and the adamantine mirror of Eudromus. But [add] the flowers of the poets, doctors, and laws. Certainly the most beautiful and [...] collection of flowers.
